Package edu.unca.csci202

Class GroceryStore

java.lang.Object
edu.unca.csci202.GroceryStore
public class GroceryStore extends Object
Class that allows for simulating a grocery store.
Author:
Caleb Knapp

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private double
    arrivalProb
    The percent chance as a decimal of a customer joining a queue in a given time step.
    private int
    maxItems
    The maximum number of items a customer can have.
    private int[]
    maxLength
    An array that keeps track of the maximum length of each line.
    private int
    numQueues
    The number of queues the grocery store has.
    private int
    processTime
    How many time steps it takes to process an item.
    private ArrayList<Queue<Customer>>
    queues
    An arraylist of the queues of customers.
    private Random
    rand
    A random Object to drive random occurences like customers joining a queue.
    private int
    servedCustomers
    The total number of customers that were fully processed.
    private int
    timeSteps
    A unit of time that is the basis for most events.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    calcTimeStep()
    Loops through all queues and adds customers and processes items.
    void
    printData()
    Prints helpful information about a runtime including the maximum length of each queue, the total number of customers served and the number of people left in a given queue.

    run(int timeSteps, double arrivalProb, int processTime, int maxItems)
    Runs a simulation of a grocery store given the settings when called.

  • Constructor Details

    • GroceryStore

      public GroceryStore(int numQueues)
      Constructor that makes an int array and arraylist of the input size.
      Parameters:
      numQueues - the number of lines the grocery store should have.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run(int timeSteps, double arrivalProb, int processTime, int maxItems)
      Runs a simulation of a grocery store given the settings when called.
      Parameters:
      timeSteps - The length of the simulations runtime.
      arrivalProb - How likely a customer is to join a line on a given time step.
      processTime - How many time steps it takes for a cashier to handle one item.
      maxItems - The maximum number of items that a customer can have.

    • calcTimeStep

      public void calcTimeStep()
      Loops through all queues and adds customers and processes items.

    • printData

      public void printData()
      Prints helpful information about a runtime including the maximum length of each queue, the total number of customers served and the number of people left in a given queue.
